      • draw

        public void draw(@NonNull
                 Graphics2D gc,
                 @NonNull
                 ImageCache imageCache,
                 Point offset)
        Draws the screen onto the specified graphics context.
        Parameters:
        gc - The graphics context to draw with.
        imageCache - The image cache to retrieve character images from.
        offset - The x/y-axis (column/row) offsets to alter the position at which the screen is drawn.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If the gc or image cache is null.

      • clear

        public void clear(char character,
                  Point position,
                  int width,
                  int height)
        Clears the specified section of the screen. Does nothing if the (columnIndex, rowIndex) or (width, height) pairs point to invalid positions.
        Parameters:
        character - The character to replace all characters being cleared with.
        position - The x/y-axis (column/row) coordinates of the cell to clear.
        width - The width of the area to clear.
        height - The height of the area to clear.

      • clear

        public void clear(char character)
        Clears the entire screen.
        Parameters:
        character - The character to replace every character on the screen with.

      • screenshot

        public BufferedImage screenshot(@NonNull
                                ImageCache imageCache)
        Draws the screen onto an image. This calls the draw function, so the screen may look a little different if there are blink effects or new updates to characters that haven't yet been drawn. This is an expensive operation as it essentially creates an in-memory screen and draws each AsciiCharacter onto that screen.
        Parameters:
        imageCache - The image cache to retrieve character images from.
        Returns:
        An image of the screen.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If the image cache is null.

      • setBackgroundColor

        public void setBackgroundColor(@NonNull
                               Color color)
        Sets the background color of all characters.
        Parameters:

        Throws:

      • addComponent

        public void addComponent(Component component)
        Adds a component to the screen and registers event listeners of the component, to the parent panel, if required. If the component is already present on the screen, then the component is not added. If the component is a screen and it has already been added to this screen, or any sub-screen of this screen, then the component is not added.
        Parameters:
        component - The component.

      • addComponents

        public void addComponents(Component... components)
        Adds one or more components to the screen.
        Parameters:
        components - The components.

      • removeComponent

        public void removeComponent(Component component)
        Removes a component from the screen and removes event listeners of the component from the parent panel.
        Parameters:
        component - The component.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the component is this.

      • removeComponents

        public void removeComponents(Component... components)

        Parameters:
        components - The components.

      • changeDrawOrder

        public void changeDrawOrder(Component stationary,
                            Component moving)
        Moves one component above another component, in the draw order. Does nothing if either component is null. Does nothing if components are not of the same type.
        Parameters:
        stationary - The component that is not being moved.
        moving - The component that is being moved.

      • getComponentByID

        public Component getComponentByID(String id)
        Retrieves the first encountered component that uses the specified ID.
        Parameters:
        id - The id.
        Returns:
        If no component matches the ID, the null is returned. Else the component is returned.

      • getButtonByID

        public Button getButtonByID(String id)
        Works the same as getComponentByID, but only returns if the result is a Button component.
        Parameters:
        id - The id.
        Returns:
        If no component matches the ID, then null is returned. If no button component matches the ID, then null is returned. Else the component is returned.
